text: With the leading edge approach, the 59 to 39 folding first builds the minimum free energy (mFE) structure for the current 39 position (from position 1 to j) and parses it with the leading edge sequence of a predefined length; typically about 7 to 10 nt and shorter than a simple stem-loop (approximately 2 or 3 times the Kuhn length). All of the existing structure is subject to editing around the leading edge. As the secondary structure calculations catch up to the calculated leading edge points, the leading edge has a chance to choose between recently formed secondary structure and a pseudoknot over the same length of sequence.
